1.text: When Larry King died, they didn't just cancel his show. They got Piers Morgan to come in and do his show, and that way Larry lives on.
1.author: Michael Scott

2.text: What is a two-way petting zoo?" "...you pet the animals and they pet you back.
2.author: Charles & Jim

3.text:
Who is Justice Beaver?"  
 "...he's a crime-fighting beaver.
3.author: Dwight & Jim

6.text: This is parkour. Internet sensation of 2004. It was in one of the Bond films. Pretty impressive. The goal is to get from point A to point B as creatively as possible. So technically they are doing parkour, so long as point A is delusion and point B is the hospital.
6.author: Jim Halpert

7.text: You all took a life here today. The life of the party.
7.author: Michael Scott

8.text: You couldn't handle my undivided attention.
8.author: Dwight Schrute

9.text: What did I tell you about "yeppers"?
9.author: Jan Levenson

10.text: Sometimes I start a sentence and I don't even know where it's going. I just hope I find it along the way.
10.author: Michael Scott

11.text: I talk A LOT, so I've just learned to tune myself out.
11.author: Kelly Kapoor

12.text: Psychiatrists tend to be more crazy than their patients. Therapists are whores. Psychiatry is a narcissism machine. I learn more from Dr. Seuss than Dr. Freud. Earth: You don't have to be crazy to live here, but it helps. ...I don't know, just use the best one.
12.author: Ryan Howard

13.text: Why are you the way that you are? ...I hate so much about the things you choose to be.
13.author: Michael Scott

14.text: Oh you're paying way too much for your worms, man. Who's your worm guy?
14.author: Creed Bratton

15.text: I'm not superstitious... but I am a little stitious.
15.author: Michael Scott

16.text: I have flaws. What are they? I sing in the shower. Sometimes I spend too much time volunteering. Cccasionally I'll hit someobody with my car. So sue me. No, don't.
16.author: Michael Scott

17.text: I feel like all my kids grew up, and then they married each other. It's every parent's dream.
17.author: Michael Scott

18.text: So there I am, minding my own business, and Darnell offers me $3. All i gotta do is walk by Andy and go like this *makes throat-cutting motion*. Darnell's a chump. I would've done it for anything. I've done a lot worse for a lot less.
18.author: Creed Bratton

19.text: Today, smoking is going to save lives.
19.author: Dwight Schrute

20.text: If 'only's and 'just's were candies and nuts, then everyday would be Erntedankfest.
20.author: Dwight Schrute

21.text:
Depression? Isn't that just a fancy word for feeling 'bummed out?'" 
"Dwight, you ignorant slut.
21.author: Dwight & Michael

22.text: There's too many people on this Earth. We need a new plague.
22.author: Dwight Schrute

24.text: Break me off a piece of that fancy feast! Nailed it.
24.author: Andy Bernard

26.text: Rember, the dundies are a black-tie affair." "Black-tie optional." "*Glares* Every day is black-tie optional.
26.author: Dwight & Michael

27.text: Yes! I love banter. But I HATE witty banter.
27.author: Kevin Malone

28.text: Who gave you those crayons?" "I brought them from home. Do you have a red?" "This is a cloth tablecloth!
28.author: Server & Kevin

29.text: Five minutes ahead of schedule. Right on schedule.
29.author: Dwight Schrute

30.text: I wonder if king-sized sheets are called presidential-sized in England. I really should have a tweeter account.
30.author: Dwight Schrute

31.text: Ah, French. It's a great language... if you're a chain-smking acrobat.
31.author: Dwight Schrute

32.text: 'R' is amongst the most menacing of sounds. That's why it's called 'murder', and not 'mukduk.'
32.author: Dwight Schrute

33.text: Disposable cameras are fun, although it does seem wasteful. And you don't ever get to see your pictures.
33.author: Erin Hannon

34.text: Is there a God? If not, what are all the churches for? And who is Jesus's dad?
34.author: Michael Scott

35.text: Sometimes I feel like everyone I work with is an idiot. And by sometimes, I mean all times. All the time. Every of the time.
35.author: Kevin Malone

36.text: Sorry I annoyed you with my friendship.
36.author: Andy Bernard

37.text: When I discovered YouTube, I didn't work for five days.
37.author: Michael Scott

38.text: I was intimidated by Andy's family before. Now I have to see the First Lady at hoidays? She'll be all 'What's your stance on politics?' or, 'What's the best war to do?' And I will just be like, 'Duhhhh.'
38.author: Erin Hannon

39.text: Please don't teach the cat French.
39.author: Angela Martin

40.text: I once reported Oscar to the INS. Turns out he's clean, but I'm glad I did it.
40.author: Angela Martin

41.text: I find the mystery genre disgusting. I hate being titillated.
41.author: Anela Martin

42.text: Do you think that doing alcohol is cool?
42.author: Michael Scott

43.text: Why do you have a diary?" "To keep secrets from my computer.
43.author: Michael & Dwight

44.text: Dwight's the only one with the spare key. I asked him, 'What if you die, Dwight? How will we get in?' He said, 'If I'm dead, you guys have been dead for weeks.'
44.author: Pam Beesly

45.text: How do I find out if a girl is interested? Great question. I usually just assume they're not.
45.author: Andy Bernard

46.text: Monkey see, monkey do. Monkey pee all over you.
46.author: Michael Scott

47.text: I know a few things about love. Horrible, terrible, awful, awful things.
47.author: Andy Bernard

48.text: In any cheating movie, the person getting cheated on is the hero. You're Ali Larter, I'm Beyonce." "I am Beyonce, always.
48.author: Andy & Michael

49.text: Yes, I have a dream, and it's not some MLK dream for equality. I want to own a decommissioned lighthouse. And I want to live at the top. And nobody knows I live there. And there's a button that I can press, and launch that lighthouse into space.
49.author: Stanley Hudson

50.text: Ok, just so I understand it: In your wildes fantasy, you are in hell, and you are co-running a bed and breafast with the devil.
50.author: Jim Halpert

51.text: Life is short. Drive fast and leave a sexy corpse. That's one of my mottos.
51.author: Stanley Hudson
